content.text: INSTRUCCIONES
Este examen contiene preguntas fáciles, medianas y difíciles.

En la sección de preguntas fáciles, el alumno se enfoca en la comprensión de las palabras clave. Por ejemplo, el uso afirmativo del “verb to be” en tiempo presente nos brinda tres opciones (am, is, are), de las cuales, sólo una será correcta. En cuanto al resto de los tiempos simples, el alumno necesita recordar las reglas gramaticales que memorizó e identificar la respuesta correcta. Los alumnos suelen olvidar las distintas reglas para conjugaciones de verbos regulares y verbos irregulares, así como la sintaxis y la ortografía (Spelling) de ciertas palabras, ya que en español las palabras se escriben como suenan.

En la sección de preguntas medianas, se requiere un conocimiento más a fondo del uso del lenguaje, comprensión lectora y de análisis que va más allá del entendimiento  de palabras  y tiempos verbales simples y la capacidad de relacionar las palabras claves con sus correspondientes significados. En este caso, es necesario entender los distintos tiempos verbales, tanto simples como compuestos, así como el correcto uso de conectores y verbos modales (o verbos auxiliares) para ser capaz de identificar errores en oraciones y pequeños textos.

Esto aplica en todas las preguntas de desarrollo mediano, donde el alumno ya sabe identificar qué es lo que gramaticalmente completa mejor una idea. En algunos casos se utilizará la comprensión de idea general y en otros tantos la información de palabras claves y la habilidad de “leer entre líneas”.

En la sección de preguntas difíciles, se requiere un conocimiento mucho más complejo del uso del lenguaje, comprensión lectora y de análisis que va más allá del entendimiento de palabras  y tiempos verbales simples y compuestos. En este caso, es necesario recordar claramente y entender los distintos tiempos verbales, así como el correcto uso de conectores, verbos modales (o verbos auxiliares) y condicionales para ser capaz de identificar errores en oraciones y textos.

Esto aplica en todas las preguntas de desarrollo avanzado o difícil, donde el alumno ya sabe identificar qué es lo que gramaticalmente completa mejor una idea y cómo esa idea podría verse con una redacción distinta.
En algunos casos se utilizará la comprensión de idea general y en otros tantos la información de palabras claves y la habilidad de “leer con detalle”.
Reading Comprehension and Vocabulary
This part of the test has two types of exercises, vocabulary and reading comprehension.
Read each question carefully and choose the best answer. There is only one correct answer.

content.text: 8 Tips for Cruising Your Problems Away

Pack Smart: Pack clothes for thematic nights you are interested in at the main restaurant. As well, make sure your clothes are accurate for the places you have on (5)route. Avoid unnecessary, last minute shopping. It is helpful if you select colors from the same palette for your wardrobe.
Arrive a Day Early: By doing this, you’ll get to explore the local culture. As well, (10) you’ll be more fresh and ready at the port, just right before starting your adventure.

Get to Know the Ship: Taking a self-guided ship tour will help you (15) discover “where” you want to do “what” during the time on the ship. This way, you’ll get to take full advantage of the time you spend here. This includes short routes to dash back to your stateroom.

Match your Tech to your Itinerary: Depending on what you are doing, where you are going and the time that is taking you, it will be smart to consider binoculars, a camera with zoom lens, a spare battery (25) (since no one wants a dead smartphone), a drone (or a mini drone), a go pro, and, for sure, a waterproof case for your smartphone.

Use the Cruise App: In the app, you can (30) find the whole ship’s itinerary, with activities all around it. As well, you may take a look at the menus in advance. It is also possible to check your ship’s account.

Take Time Out: Wanting to “take advantage” of every second on the cruise might be hard to understand and internalize. It is only fair that you take moments to enjoy the wonderful views, to do absolutely nothing and to relax. You (40) might even take a spa’s treatment, since they normally have sales on the ship.

Document your Trip: Besides the obvious (taking pictures and videos of your experiences), try writing or drawing (45) about them while you have them “fresh”. This will be awesome material for you and your traveling partners later on.

content.title: Question 20
content.question: What is the purpose of the text?
options: To give recommendations on how to take a cruise and to get a more enjoyable experience.
To persuade the reader to take a cruise.

content.text: 8 Tips for Cruising Your Problems Away

content.class: flex flex-col gap-2 bg-slate-200 p-4 text-xl

content.text:
Oh, Dreams Dreams Dreams
When I was a little girl, my head was filled with dreams. I wanted to be a lawyer, so I could defend those who were not being treated with justice. I also felt like (5)modeling, because most things in life might not be as perfect as a fashion show, but, by modeling, I would have been surrounded by beauty. Most of all, I wanted to be a member of the Educational System, (10)to be part of what I consider, is the base of everything.

content.class: flex flex-col gap-2 bg-slate-200 p-4 text-xl

content.text:
The Expectations
For a long time, I worked as an English teacher. But suddenly, I got an offer I could not refuse: an important company wanted (15) me to train teachers, even if I have not done it before, even if I was too young. They said “Talent is not defined by age, and we are sure that your skills will help you accomplish an excellent job”.

content.class: flex flex-col gap-2 bg-slate-200 p-4 text-xl

content.text:
The Preparation
(20) For weeks, I studied the Program, the topics, the inner organization.. I rehearsaled in front of my mirror and, sometimes, even recorded myself while speaking. I gave my whole heart to this (25) project. After all, I was finally making an impact on the ones who influence the young minds every day.

content.class: flex flex-col gap-2 bg-slate-200 p-4 text-xl

content.text:
The Difficulties
Just the afternoon before the team and I had to teach, the company let us know that (30) due to the interest in the Program, the number of teachers to be trained had increased. The digits now were about the double of the initial amount. This meant, we had to recount all of the the materials (35) we were needing for each group (which were more than eleven) and most of all, it meant that my nervousness and my anxiety were increasing by the minute.

content.class: flex flex-col gap-2 bg-slate-200 p-4 text-xl

content.text:
The Greatest Moments
Once we arrived to the conference center, (40) the tutors (all of us) took our materials, gave our best wishes to each other and looked for our classrooms. It was only then, that I had to forget about all of my fears : fear about failing, feeling (45) scared about not being enough for those teachers, suspecting that I did not know enough. I mean, who did I think I was? I was only a young English teacher that came from a small city. (50) So, I took the biggest breath and started my lecture. It was at that very moment when I knew what I wanted to do for the years to come: My desire was to improve my teaching in order to lead (55) others to do the same.

content.class: flex flex-col gap-2 bg-slate-200 p-4 text-xl

content.text:
The Learning Time
I am sure my lecture that day (and the following ones) was far from perfect. It was what it was. But that is it. As humans, we learn by doing, not only from studying. (60)Looking back on this moment, it is amazing to see how much I have grown, how much I have evolved. If you are lucky and work hard enough, this process never stops. You have to take some risks when (65) you are trying to find something that makes you passionate again. That makes you better. You must learn it will not be easy, nor perfect, but it sure will be worth it. So, my advice is for you to take all of the (70) chances you get. You will surely regret more what you did not do, than what you actually did!

content.text: Part 2
In the below exercises you will find paragraphs with underlined words. After reading each text, choose the option with a similar meaning

When deciding to get married, it is common for people to fear being <u>stranded</u> by their partners. This, in any moment of the wedding process, or even, afterwards (5) the event has finished and the years have gone by. Nowadays, having a long term relationship is more <u>frangible</u>  than it was thirty years ago. The use of social media and the extended freedom that most (10) people act on, is not helpful for this matter. Even though it is harder to commit now, it is <u>habitual</u> to hear from people we know that they got engaged to be married. In conclusion, you can have a wonderful, (15) married life if you work on it every day.

content.text: How Hard is it to be an Entrepreneur?
An entrepreneur is a person who operates a business taking if not all, most of the financial risks in order to do so.

It sounds complex, and it is. But it is also an exciting thing to do. Did you know that out of the total world population, over 600 million are entrepreneurs? From every 13 people in the world, 1 owns a business.
It is common to hear about how lucky successful entrepreneurs are, but they are people who make their own luck.
While a lot of points may be different for entrepreneurs, certain things remain common among them. Here are 6 important facts about them:

1. They are quite persistent. It is impossible to make it to the top without staying with your business long enough. As a business man or woman, you will go through difficult and tough times. But when talking about persistence, no one beats entrepreneurs.
2. Convenience is not in their books. Especially during the beginning of their stories, they give up on all the luxuries they had and invest in their business.
3. Entrepreneurs work long hours. Surveys have revealed that they work between 30 and 60 hours per week, while the majority work between 40 and 59 hours per week.

4. Benefit the society. Most entrepreneurs plan to provide a product or service that satisfies the needs of the public. Even if the economical part is surely important, they also desire to benefit others with what they are providing.

5. Curiosity is crucial. While being in a full-time job may keep your head in clear, systematic guidelines, being an entrepreneur is about keeping asking questions, keep on investigating and creating new products, new services, new ways of doing things.

6. Plan A, B, C, D. While entrepreneurs are persistent, they are also prepared for their businesses not to rise or work right away. They must have other sources of income, at least at the beginning. Dreams are important, but people also need to find a way to make a living while they chase their dreams. Entrepreneurs are prepared for that. If not, most businesses will fail within the first 6 months of existence.
Being an entrepreneur is an interesting challenge and path to take, isn’t it?
